content:
• Friday, September 12, 2014

  • After Hour Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: TWGP +5.4%. CDE +3.4%. SWN +2.9%. RWLK +2.5%. DRII +2.5%.
    • Top losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: BAH -3.9%. ODP -2.4%. CGA -2.1%. AFMD -1.8%. TC -1.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM | 6 Comments

  • Weekly ETF Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: VXX +4.23%. GAZ +1.26%. UNG +1.01%. UUP +0.58%. TAN +0.12%.
    • Losers: EWZ -10.12%. BRF -8.96%. ILF -7.29%. REMX -5.31%. VNQ -5.21%.
       
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • SLB

    Schlumberger seen as likely Petrobras service contract winner

    • Schlumberger (SLB -1.9%) is favored to win half of more than $2B in well services work being offered by Petrobras (PBR -6.7%) after submitting the most competitive bid for a package representing 50% of the work, Bloomberg reports.
    • Halliburton (HAL -1.7%) is said to have placed the lowest-cost bid for 30% of the job, and Baker Hughes (BHI -1.6%) appears positioned to win the remaining 20%.
    • The contract involves a cabling technology used by energy companies to lower equipment into wells for repairs and maintenance or to evaluate reservoirs; SLB is the biggest global provider of these wireline services in a ~$20B/year market.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM
  • NE

    Noble, Seadrill sink as driller market continues to soften

    • It's another down day for offshore drillers after rig owner Noble Corp. (NE -4.5%) signs a pair of new contracts for work in the Gulf of Mexico at substantially reduced dayrates.
    • NE's updated fleet status report highlighted a new contract for the Danny Adkins in the Gulf in a minimum 200-day program at $317K/day vs, its previous rate of $498K/day and analyst expectations for the high $300K; the less than rosy update prompts Johnson RIce to lower its 2014 and 2015 EPS estimates to $3.06 and $2.98 from $3.16 and $3.27 previously.
    • Seadrill (SDRL -5.4%) also is getting smacked after offering up its own pessimistic take on the offshore drilling industry, and its deal with Rosneft could be threatened by the latest sanctions imposed on Russia by the U.S. and EU.
    • Also:Â RIG -3.6%, ESV -3.6%, DO -3.7%, RDC -1.4%, PACD -2.9%, SDLP -4.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM | 36 Comments
  • CCJ

    Cameco reaches agreement to end strike at world's largest uranium mine

    • Cameco (CCJ +2.5%) reaches a tentative agreement with the United Steelworkers Union to end a two-week strike at McArthur River in Saskatchewan, the world’s top producing uranium mine.
    • The union says workers will begin returning to the McArthur River mine and Key Lake mill as early as today.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • TSL

    Solar stocks sizzle after Trina says it can't keep up with demand

    • Solar stocks are on the move after Trina Solar (TSL +3.7%) CEOÂ Gao Jifan says its factories are operating at full capacity but the company still can't meet the demand for its solar panels.
    • China's top three solar panel makers are at full capacity and will have to expand their production, Gao says, noting that TSL's solar panel production will rise to 3.8 GW by year-end, up from ~3.4 GW at the end of June.
    • China recently announced new subsidies for smaller solar energy projects, which Goldman Sachs says will make selling power to the country's electrical grid much more lucrative for the operators and will cause prices of solar components to rise.
    • CSIQ +2.6%, CSUN +7.4%, YGE +3%, FSLR +1.7%, SPWR +0.8%, JASO +2.4%, SOL +5.4%.
    • ETFs: TAN, KWT
     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM | 2 Comments
  • AFMD

    Affirmed Therapeutics stumbles in debut

    • Investors lack enthusiasm for Affirmed Therapeutics (NASDAQ:AFMD) in its debut today. Shares are downÂ 9%Â from the $7 offer price on turnover of 2.6M.
    • The German clinical-state biopharmaceutical firm focuses on cancer immunotherapies. Its lead product is is the TandAb AFM13 for Hodgkin Lymphoma. It is currently in Phase 2 clinicals.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM | 1 Comment
  • RWLK

    Rewalk Robotics off to a strong start

    • Investors are showing Rewalk Robotics (NASDAQ:RWLK)Â a lot of love in its debut today. Shares are upÂ 80%Â from the $12 offer price on turnover of almost 8M.
    • The company makes a robotic exoskeleton that enables a paraplegic to stand and walk. The firm's founder, Dr. Amit Goffer, knows how profound an innovation this is. He is a quadriplegic.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM | 4 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Top 10 Gainers: NETE +46%. CGA +32%. CNVR +30%. HOTR +23%. VNET +29%. NOR +23%. LTRX +24%. SPWH +21%. ULTA +19%. LAKE +18%.
    • Top 10 Losers: AMRN -21%. EFOI -13%. RSH -12%. ALXA -12%. HDY -11%. LUNA -10%. KUTV -9%. SYN -8%. ISNS -8%. HCCI -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • GOOG

    eBay shoots down chatter of Google stake

    • "We've had no conversations with Google (GOOG -0.7%) about [it] acquiring a stake in the company," says eBay (EBAY +2.3%) spokesman Alan Marks.
    • Previously: eBay spikes over speculation on Google stake
     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM | 10 Comments
  • TMUS

    T-Mobile adds record 552K postpaid customers in August, CEO says

    • T-Mobile US (TMUS +1.7%) added 552K postpaid customers in August, more customer additions than any other month in the company's history, and added 208K prepaid customers, CEO John Legere tells investors at the Goldman Conference in NYC.
    • The wave of new subscribers was in part due to the popularity of a promotion that allows customers to add four lines for $100/month, Legere says.
    • Earlier, Argus upgraded shares to Buy from Hold with a $40 price target, saying a series of innovative plans promoted with razzle-dazzle marketing is gaining traction with subscribers; the firm also expects the latest TMUS offer, which facilitates Wi-Fi communications and interoperability with the cellular network, to resonate with subscribers.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 3 Comments
  • IRET

    Investors Real Estate continues post-earnings slide; RBC downgrades

    • Adjusted FFO of $0.12 per share was shy of the dividend by $0.01 and - on the earnings call (transcript) - RBC's Michael Salinksy pressed management on whether it's rolling back its goal of dividend coverage to 2016 from 2015. Management's response is they are still shooting or 2015, but it's looking like 2016 is the more likely scenario at this point.
    • RBC today downgrades Investors Real Estate Trust (IRET -4%) to Underperform, with price target cut to $8 from $9.
    • Previously: Investors Real Estate Trust misses by $0.02, beats on revenue
     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM
  • AU

    Report: AngloGold share sale pushed by South Africa's central bank

    • South Africa’s central bank pressed AngloGold Ashanti (AU +2.2%) to increase the size of a planned share sale that’s opposed by hedge fund manager John Paulson, Bloomberg reports.
    • AU is said to have initially sought to raise just over $1B from investors to strengthen its balance sheet, but that was increased to $2.1B to satisfy the concerns of the South African Reserve Bank over the split of the company into separate entities housing South African and international operations.
    • The bank’s insistence may help explain why AU is moving forward with a plan that saw its shares fall sharply and drew criticism from investors including Paulson.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • EBAY

    eBay spikes over speculation on Google stake

    • Shares of eBay (EBAY +3.3%) spike higher on what Bloomberg is reporting is speculation over a stake by Google.
    • eBay was trading in negative territory before the buying flurry started.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM | 1 Comment
  • LULU

    Analysts weigh in on Lululemon

    • Lululemon's (LULU +3.3%) earnings beat this week had a lot to do with conservative guidance, says BMO Nesbitt Burn's John Morris.
    • The analyst thinks visibility is still lacking on the apparel seller's sale and margin recovery.
    • Citigroup warns on a mix shift at Lululemon to lower-margin items and pricing pressure from competitors.
    • There's still plenty of positive to latch onto say other analysts leaning to the bullish side. The addition of new "smart money" board members at the company and the expansive growth of the athletic apparel category gives Lululemon long-term potential.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM | 2 Comments
  • IDT

    IDT Corp. +4% after agreeing to sell Fabrix Systems

    • IDT Corporation (IDT +4%) will get around $74M for its 78% stake in Fabrix Systems (Ericson is buying Fabrix for $95M).
    • Bullish on IDT for some time, SA Pro author Whopper Investments has mixed feelings on the sale - he had valued IDT's stake at $70M, so there's a bit of a boost there. On the other hand, there had been chatter IBM offered $100M for Fabrix a few years back and Fabrix has grown significantly since - seeing it sold for less than that amount is a bit of a disappointment.
    • IDT, says Whopper, remains very cheap, and perhaps a buyback is in order with the cash from the sale (but don't hold your breath).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM

  • Bond yields continue September surge higher

    • It's taken less than two weeks in September to erase all of the summer's big gains in long-term Treasury prices. Today's five basis point jump in the 10-year yield to 2.60% brings it above the level it was at just after the Memorial Day weekend.
    • If Europe led yields south during the summer, it's leading them north now, with the German 10-year Bund yield up another five basis points to 1.05% after sinking to below 0.9% two weeks ago. Italian, Spanish, and British yields are sharply higher as well (though all three countries sport 10-year rates lower than the U.S.).
    • TLTÂ -0.7%, TBTÂ +1.4%
    • ETFs: TBT, TLT, TMV, IEF, TBF, EDV, PST, TMF, TTT, ZROZ, SBND, TLH, IEI, TYO, DLBS, DTYS, VGLT, UST, UBT, VGIT, TLO, TBX, GSY, SCHR, TENZ, DTYL, LBND, ITE, TYD, TYBS, DLBL, TBZ, DFVL, FIVZ, DFVS, TYNS
     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM | 3 Comments
  • AUTO

    Autobytel opens strong, sees Q3 revenues at high end of guidance

    • Autobytel (ABTL +7.2%) opens strong after saying it sees Q3 revenue growth of 25%-26% Y/Y, at the high end of its previously announced guidance, and reiterates its guidance for Q3 adjusted EBITDA of $0.22-$0.25/share.
    • ABTL says expected Q3 results are based on solid July and August business trends and a strong start to September, reflecting a strong auto leads business and ongoing healthy automotive market.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM
  • CALM

    Cal-Maine Foods higher after upgrade

    • Shares of Cal-Maine Foods (CALM +2.6%) trade higher after Sidoti upgrades the company to a Buy rating from Neutral.
    • Though the food stock is already on a 38% YTD run, Cal-Maine's aggressive acquisition strategy continues to pay off, note analysts.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:40 AM
  • WELL

    Health Care REIT -3.1% after pricing secondary

    • The 15.5M share offering priced at $63.75 each, with the underwriters retaining an option to buy another 2.325M shares at that price.
    • If the greenshoe is exercised, gross proceeds to Health Care REIT (HCN -3.1%) will be about $1.1B (about $988M if not).
    • Previously: Health Care REIT with secondary; details acquisition pipeline
     
     
     
     
    | 9:36 AM
  • TSL

    Trina Solar CEO: We can't meet demand

    • “Right now Trina (NYSE:TSL) is producing at 100 percent capacity and selling at all rates, yet we still can’t meet all customer demand,” CEO Gao Jifan tells Bloomberg.
    • All of China's big three solar-panel makers are running at full capacity and need to boost capacity, he says, noting (without providing details) a the results of a survey unveiled yesterday at an industry conference. Trina's solar-panel capacity will rise to 3.8 gigawatts this year from roughly 3.4 gigawatts at the end of June, says Gao, and solar-cell capacity will rise to 2.8 gigawatts from 2.4.
    • Trina +2.1%Â in early action, with JinkoSolar (NYSE:JKS)Â -0.8%, and JA Solar (NASDAQ:JASO)Â +0.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:33 AM | 3 Comments
  • ULTA

    Investment firms back Ulta Salon for more gains

    • Ulta Salon (NASDAQ:ULTA) catches a wave of price target increases after smashing earnings estimates, led by strong e-commerce sales.
    • PT boosts: Citi to $130; Baird to $125; Jefferies to $110; Sterne Agee to $125.
    • The firm stands a chance of being disruptive as consumers warm up to buying more beauty product online, say analysts.
    • Previous: earnings, details, CFO disclosure
    • ULTA +17.1% premarket to $114.25.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:30 AM
  • AMRN

    Amarin off big premarket

    • Amarin (NASDAQ:AMRN) plummetsÂ 26%Â premarket on robust volume in response to the company's announcement that the FDA denied its appeal on the regulator's rescission of the ANCHOR SPA.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM | 6 Comments
  • TWTR

    Twitter upsizes and prices convertible note offering

    • Originally offering $1.3B in convertible notes, Twitter (NYSE:TWTR) ends up selling $1.8B worth - $900M maturing in five years, and another $900M in seven. The underwriters have the option to purchase another $100M of each issue.
    • With net proceeds (forgetting the greenshoe) expected to be about $1.77B, one wonders if there's an acquisition target in sight.
    • The 5-year paper carries a 0.25% coupon and the 7-year 1%. The initial conversation rate for both is 12.8793 shares of common stock per $1K principal amount of notes - an equivalent conversion price of about $77.64 per share.
    • Shares -0.5%Â premarket to $52.38.
    • Previously: Twitter lower by 1.1% after convertible note offering
     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM | 3 Comments
  • ULTA

    Ulta Salon soars post-earnings (but check the conference call)

    • Shares of Ulta Salon (NASDAQ:ULTA) are ripping in early action, but there could be a devil in the details.
    • "About half of our earnings outperformance in the quarter was due to the impact that SG&A expenses moved later in the year," disclosed CFO Scott Settersten during the firm's earnings call (transcript).
    • ULTA +17.7% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 1 Comment

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: CNVR +32%. ULTA +17%. CGA +12%. OTC:ASTI +10%. SCOK +9%. XPO +9%. FUEL +6%. S +5%.
    • Losers: AMRN -28%. OXBT -14%. ONTY -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM
  • TNET

    TriNet prices secondary offering at $25.50 per share

    • The sale of stock by General Atlantic - first announced on Monday afternoon - was upsized to 12M shares from 10.5M, and the underwriters have an option to buy another 1.8M shares at the $25.50 sale price.
    • TNETÂ +1.9%Â premarket to $26.21.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:54 AM
  • ASTI

    Ascent Solar regains compliance with Nasdaq price rule

    • Ascent Solar (OTC:ASTI) +12.4% premarket after announcing it had regained compliance with Nasdaq's minimum bid price rule.
    • ASTI's closing bid price of its common stock for the 10 business days prior to Sept. 11 met the minimum bid price requirement.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM
  • NPSP

    Trading halt for NPS Pharma

    • NASDAQ halts trading in NPS Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:NPSP) pending news from today's Ad Comm meeting reviewing the company's Natpara (rhPTH [1-84]) BLA.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:28 AM | 3 Comments
  • DRI

    Board battle raging at Darden Restaurants

    • Darden Restaurants (NYSE:DRI) responds to the transformation plan offered up by Starboard Value this morning by leaning on its recent uptick in traffic trends.
    • The company also maintains some of the Starboard strategies are already being implemented.
    • Naturally, Darden wants shareholders to vote for its board nominees.
    • Darden's Annual Shareholder Meeting is scheduled for October 10.
    • DRI +2.8% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:06 AM | 1 Comment
  • S

    Sprint boosted as Cowen upgrades, iPhone for Life Plan detailed

    • Impressed with management changes at Sprint (NYSE:S) and seeing the stock as a long-term investment opportunity, Cowen upgrades to Outperform with $8 price target.
    • In other news, Sprint plans to offer the new iPhones beginning on Sept. 19 and announces the iPhone for Life Plan, allowing customers to get a new iPhone for $20 per month for 24 months and the guarantee of a new device every two years.
    • SharesÂ +2.4%Â premarket after yesterday'sÂ 6.8% gain.
    • Previously: Sprint on the move as Claure addresses conference
     
     
     
     
    | 7:46 AM
